title: Farmer shot dead two women months after cops gave him back his guns... to shoot foxes
text:
News Farmer shot dead two women months after cops gave him back his guns... to shoot foxes John Lowe had seven firearms seized after he was accused of threats to kill but they were handed back and he went on to murder his partner Christine Lee and her daughter Lucy Share Christine Lee with killer partner John Lowe (Photo: Daily Mirror) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A farmer murdered two women after police agreed to return his ­shotguns so he could protect his ­chickens from foxes. 
Police seized seven firearms from John Lowe, 84, when stepdaughter Stacy Banner, 42, accused him of threatening to kill her. 
But he got the weapons back after complaining he had lost 80 hens. 
Seven months later he gunned down partner Christine Lee, 66, and her daughter Lucy, 40, in cold blood. 
The Independent Police Complaints Commission has since found two police licensing officers may have been criminally negligent. 
But prosecutors have now decided there is “insufficient evidence” to charge them with misconduct. 
A friend of the victims said: “We are dumbfounded by the ­decision. John Lowe in prison van as he arrives for his trial (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
“Police knew about Lowe and his threats to kill, yet decided the lives of chickens were more ­important than the lives of people.” 
Lowe shot Christine and then Lucy at his puppy-breeding farm near Farnham, Surrey, in February 2014. 
He told police he “put down” the pair because they had been “giving me sh**” for weeks. Lowe will die behind bars after being convicted at Guildford crown court of both murders . 
Eleven months before the double killing, Stacy – Christine’s other daughter – told police Lowe pointed a gun at her and threatened “to blow my head off”. After three weeks, she told officers she did not want to support a prosecution due to his age. Lucy Lee was murdered with her mum (Photo: Daily Mirror) The scene of the farm shootings (Photo: PA) 
An internal report gave three reasons for returning Lowe’s seized guns. The first stated his “livelihood” was suffering as a result of fox attacks. The second and third related to medical and financial matters. 
But the IPCC found staff failed to properly review Lowe’s police file. A source revealed the report said they “may have committed a criminal offence”. However, the Crown Prosecution Service will take no action. Lowe’s stepdaughter Stacy Banner at the trial (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Surrey Police said one of the staff will now face a gross misconduct hearing, while the other has retired. 
It can now also be reported for the first time that Lowe’s stepdaughter Stacy was convicted in January of defrauding Lowe’s former partner. 
She withdrew £107,000 from dying Susanna Wilson’s bank account, Guildford crown court heard. Stacy was given a suspended sentence. Like us on Facebook
